TR_DEVICE_SETTINGS_PASSPHRASE_DESC:
A passphrase adds a custom phrase (like a word, sentence, or string of characters) to your existing wallet backup, creating a Passphrase wallet. Each Passphrase wallet has its own passphrase. Your standard wallet remains accessible without a passphrase.

Don't forget your passphrase. Unlike regular passwords, passphrases can't be recovered. If you lose it, your funds will be permanently lost.

TR_EXCHANGE_SWAP_SLIPPAGE_INFO: Exchange rates shift constantly, so the amount you accept in this offer and the amount ultimately confirmed on the blockchain may differ; this is slippage. Slippage tolerance sets the percentage of your transaction you may lose due to slippage; in other words, you set the minimum amount you are willing to accept in the end. If slippage tolerance is too high, you may receive a lot less than offered. If slippage tolerance is too low, your transaction may fail (revert) and you'll still pay the transaction fee.

TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_1: Tip: You can search for transaction IDs, addresses, tokens, labels, amounts, and dates.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_10: Tip: Combine AND (&) and OR (|) operators for more complex searches. For example > {lastYear}-01-01 & < {lastYear}-01-31 | > {lastYear}-12-01 & < {lastYear}-12-31 will show all transactions in January or December {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_2: Tip: Use the greater than (>) and less than (<) symbols for amount searches. For example 1 will show all transactions that have an amount of 1 and higher.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_3: Tip: You can search for exact amounts using the equal (=) symbol. For example = 0.01 will show only transactions that have an amount of exactly 0.01.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_4: Tip: You can exclude an amount by using the exclamation mark and equal symbols together (!=). For example != -0.01 will show all transactions except the ones with an amount of -0.01.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_5: Tip: Dates can be searched using the YYYY-MM-DD format. For example {lastYear}-12-14 will show all transactions on December 14th, {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_6: Tip: Use greater than (>) and lesser than (<) symbols on date searches. For example > {lastYear}-12-01 will show all transactions on and after December 1st, {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_7: Tip: You can exclude a date by using the exclamation mark and equal symbols together (!=). For example != {lastYear}-12-14 will show all transactions except the ones on December 14th, {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_8: Tip: You can display results matching at least one of multiple searches by grouping them with the OR operator (|). For example {lastYear}-11-30 | {lastYear}-12-01 will show all transactions that have happened on the 30th of November or the 1st of December {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TIP_9: Tip: Display results matching multiple searches by grouping them with the AND operator (&). For example > {lastYear}-12-01 & < {lastYear}-12-31 & > 0 will show all incoming (amount higher than 0) transactions in December {lastYear}.
TR_TRANSACTIONS_SEARCH_TOOLTIP: Search by transaction ID, label or amount or use operators such as < > | & = !=.
